Comments_List: I increased my vocabulary and intuition for the language.
My Russian skills significantly improved over the course of the semester. I am much more comfortable with difficult material and now seek out independent learning opportunities.
Improved speaking, vocabulary, oral comprehension, and understanding of Russian culture.
Better grasp of Russian grammar and expanded vocabulary.
The course is very well thought out, I really believe it is great how it is.
The course is slightly unorganized, but this may just stem from the size of the class. Overall it is an excellent course - very interesting, engaging and challenging.
Great course overall. Would recommend less emphasis on the textbook for daily instruction and a slight variance in the homework assignments.

Strengths: Daily homework, numbers practice

Weaknesses: Practice speaking

I feel as though I've improved in writing, reading, and listening, but I don't think I've improved my speaking very much. Speaking is the most difficult part of learning a language for me, so I think it would benefit me to have more opportunities (both formal and informal) to speak for extended periods.
Highly recommend. Professor Dolgova does a great job and really makes you appreciate and love the language.
I highly recommend this course to students looking to expand upon and improve their working Russian knowledge. It is also fun and provides a great sense of community.

Yes! 

I really enjoy the language and Professor Dolgova and Ms. Nordgaard are both great instructors. They are both very willing to help outside of class and they put a lot of effort into ensuring that we get useful feedback. The workload is definitely manageable.
